title: How do I set up multiple users on same email account, multiple computers
content:
I have seen lots of questions with the opposite tack. If there is already an answer here, I apologize for not finding it and asking again.

I support a small business. The main email address is office@<mydomain>.com. Three of us monitor that account, on three separate computers. We have always struggled with not knowing if one of the others already responded to an email or not. This has led to us either spamming the person submitting the inquiry, or all of us "ignoring" it by assuming someone else responded.

Is there a way for Thunderbird to monitor and indicate if the email was replied to on any of the systems, not just the one we're sitting in front of? We own the domain and host our email server through inmotion hosting, which gives us lots of control if something needs to be configured server-side.

title: Emails Lost When Thunderbird Crashed Mid Download
content:
Hello, I have Thunderbird set up to download emails from my isp, and it's set up to clear the messages from the web server once downloaded. I check my messages on the isp webmail service during the day, so I know roughly how many messages will be downloading when I run Thunderbird.

Last night Thunderbird crashed midway through downloading emails and it took several attempts to reopen it. When I did get back in emails from the past 3 days are not in the inbox, but they have been deleted from the web server. They weren't in the deleted folder when I checked.

I contacted my isp to ask if they could recover the emails, but they didn't think they could with the emails having been deleted from the server.

I'm unable to confirm if the emails did download but they were removed from the web server so I wanted to know if there was any way to recover them within Thunderbird? Thanks in advance

title: show message after antivirus check exchange
content:
Hi all, My organization uses MS Exchange and when an email with attachments arrives, the server performs an antivirus check and "sends" an email with a "antivirus checking" msg as an attached txt file. TB (on Win10) shows this email msg. Some seconds later, the exchange server "resends" the mail with the real attachment (after the check is done), TB deletes the previous one but does not show the new one, which is totally lost unless I close and reopen TB works.

It is clear TB does something at startup that is somehow special. My question is: is there a way I can have TB do these "special" things without closing and reopening?

It's really annoying because I have to look at my phone to see if a new msg is in my inbox.

Thanks!
creator: fabrizio.iozzi

title: Every time Thunderbird restarts, cannot login to office365 server
content:
I have to manage a number of joint email addresses which are outlook.com addresses, so I have them all installed on Thunderbird.

Up until recently, it worked fine, although every few months Outlook.com would not allow the sync because of some security issue (wanting an alternative email address, wanting an alternative phone number, wanting me to confirm that the last sync was me). I would sign in to the email account on a browser, fix the issue, and then it would work again.

As of a few days ago, Thunderbird is showing the "Login to account XXX failed" and "Login to server outlook.office365.com with username XXX failed" for maybe a dozen of the addresses every time I open Thunderbird. If I login to the email on a browser, and force Thunderbird to "Retry" several times, it will sync the account - but the next day, the same issue arises with the same account. When I check the account activity, it shows successful automatic syncs.

Is there another setting I need to check or change to make Thunderbird work with Outlook.com addresses?
creator: sarahlboyd

title: personalizzazione mail create in Access
content:
Buonasera a tutti e grazie in anticipo a chi vorrà darmi una mano. Utilizzo Microsoft Access e trovo utile inviare delle email direttamente dai report che contengono le info che voglio spedire (Ordini o reportistica di altro genere)

SITUAZIONE ATTUALE Attualmente utilizzo un pulsante "Invia Mail" che, tramite codice VBA, apre Thunderbird e compone i campi A;Oggetto;Corpo, allego poi manualmente un PDF e Invio.

COSA VORREI Vorrei comporre i campi "A" e "Oggetto" con dati personalizzati da codice VBA in Access. Sarebbe poi bello creare un PDF con lo stesso codice e allegarlo in automatico alla mail (in Thunderbird) Possibilmente personalizzare anche qualcosa nel corpo ma è meno importante.

Ecco il codice:

Private Sub CmdInviaOrdine_Click()

Dim percorsoTB As String Dim thund As String


If Len(Nz(Dir("C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe"), 0)) > 0 Then percorsoTB = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe "

Else percorsoTB = "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe "

End If


thund = percorsoTB & _ "-compose " & """" & _ "to='ciccio@bomba.com'," & _ "cc=," & _ "bcc=," & _ "subject='Ordine Cliente'," & _ "attachment=," & _ "body='Ciao, trasmetto ordine e rimango in attesa di relativa conferma. Grazie.'" & """"

Call Shell(thund, vbNormalFocus)


End Sub

Grazie ancora.

Fabio
creator: fabio.capuzzo

title: Hotmail accounts password issues
content:
First, thank you for your help. Next, up until 2 days ago, my thunderbird worked great for my multiple accounts. Than all of my accounts at once said it could not login to the server with the userid/password. I then did the folllowing.

1). Manually logged in through website for hotmail for all accounts and my userid/passwords are right. 2). I updated the thunderbird program. Did not help. 3). Removed accounts manually and added them back into thunderbird. Still had problems. 4). Went out to the microsoft account management and switched 2 step process login and turned that off. Did not solve the problem. 5). Read online and saw that people change the authentication method to: OEAUTH2. I put in the password when the window popped up to login to my account, but if I close down the program and open it later, it pops up this box to login again. Switched it back to normal password. 6). Verified passwords are correct in Password manager.

Now what is interesting is if I have it as normal password, sometimes when I click "retry" for the password, it magically works and pulls in my emails. I thought maybe it was related to my internet connection, so I tried it on 3 different internet connections and I get the same results.

My setup is as follows:

server: outlook.office365.com Port: 993 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Server Type IMAP server


It is frustrating because like I said sometimes I click retry and it works for that specific account.

Thank you again for all of your help.

Jeff

title: Sent Message Error
content: Following automatic update to Thunderbird 115.7.0 on my MacBook Pro laptop (11,4 - 15 in. 2015, OS 10.13.6), Thunderbird suddenly stopped sending messages out of my primary e-mail account (Spectrum Road Runner). Upon clicking Send, the progress bar displays momentarily, then disappears and the following "Send Message Error" appears: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <r*******@twcny.rr.com> sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth. Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again." Consultation with Spectrum Road Runner tech support confirmed that the problem is not on Spectrum's end. Thunderbird account settings seem to be in order. Curiously, though, I have three other "profiles" in Thunderbird e-mail (two locally hosted by a small firm and one aol.com) and all three function normally, including sending. Any insights would be most appreciated, as such tech problems are way above my pay grade. Thank you.
